qas.question: What are two billion people in the world deficient in?
800,000 children worldwide die each year due to what?
What is recommended by the WHO for malnutrition and diarrhea?
Why shouldn't zinc be given alone to those with several deficiencies?
What are five billion people in the world deficient in?
How many children are born each year due to zinc?
What is recommended by the WHO for malnutrition and fever?
Why shouldn't zinc be given alone to those with no deficiencies?

context: Nearly two billion people in the developing world are <a1_0>deficient in <a0_0><b4_0>zinc<b4_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>. In children it causes an increase in infection and diarrhea, contributing to the death of <b5_0>about 800,000 children worldwide<b5_0/> per year. The World Health Organization advocates <a2_0><b6_0>zinc supplementation<b6_0/><a2_0/> for severe malnutrition and diarrhea. Zinc supplements help prevent disease and reduce mortality, especially among children with low birth weight or stunted growth. However, zinc supplements should not be administered alone, because many in the developing world have several deficiencies, and <a3_0><b7_0>zinc interacts with other micronutrients<b7_0/>.
